chapter.title: Upgrading OpenAM Core Services
chapter.para: This chapter shows you how to patch and to upgrade OpenAM core services. See the Policy Agent Installation Guide for instructions on upgrading OpenAM agents.

note.para: For complex and legacy deployments, ForgeRock can assist you through the upgrade process. Send mail to info@forgerock.com for more information.

procedure.title: To Upgrade From OpenAM 9.5 Or Later
procedure.para: ForgeRock has considerably simplified OpenAM core services upgrade with respect to earlier versions. If you have already moved to OpenAM 9.5 or later, follow these steps.

step.para: If you have customized end user OpenAM files for your deployment, build a new .war with the new version of OpenAM that includes your customizations.
Stop the container where OpenAM is running.
step.screen: $ /etc/init.d/tomcat stop Password: Using CATALINA_BASE: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_HOME: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_TMPDIR: /path/to/tomcat/temp Using JRE_HOME: /path/to/jdk1.6/jre Using CLASSPATH: /path/to/tomcat/bin/bootstrap.jar: /path/to/tomcat/bin/tomcat-juli.jar

step.para: Make a copy of the OpenAM configuration directory.
If you have an external configuration directory, make a backup copy of the OpenAM configuration.
Move the current OpenAM web application aside.
step.screen: $ cd /path/to/tomcat/webapps $ mv openam openam-orig ; mv openam.war openam.war.orig

step.para: Deploy the new OpenAM in place of the old.
Start the container to run the new OpenAM.
step.screen: $ /etc/init.d/tomcat start Password: Using CATALINA_BASE: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_HOME: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_TMPDIR: /path/to/tomcat/temp Using JRE_HOME: /path/to/jdk1.6/jre Using CLASSPATH: /path/to/tomcat/bin/bootstrap.jar: /path/to/tomcat/bin/tomcat-juli.jar

step.para: In your browser, visit the location where OpenAM is deployed, such as http://openam.example.com:8080/openam, and then click Upgrade to OpenAM .

textobject.para: The initial upgrade screen lets you choose to upgrade or to restore the configuration.

step.para: In the Upgrading OpenAM screen, click Save Report to download an OpenAM Upgrade Report listing necessary configuration changes, and then click Upgrade.

textobject.para: The upgrade report screen lets you keep an upgrade report listing configuration changes in case of error.

step.para: When upgrade completes, click Proceed to Login to login to the OpenAM console and continue your work.

textobject.para: The upgrade complete screen tells you the new version of OpenAM is ready to use.

procedure.title: Upgrading From OpenAM 9.0 & Earlier
procedure.para: Upgrade from earlier products is briefly described alongside the scripts you may require.

step.para: Start planning the process by first reading the README on upgrade, /path/to/new/OpenAM/upgrade/README/README.
